littlefish.core.fish module¶

class littlefish.core.fish.Brain(neurons=None, connections=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

brain class, the neural network from eye to muscle

a ‘brain’ has a couple of sets of 8 eyes (brain.Eye object, each at each border pixel of the body). each set of eyes are receiving inputs from different objects. i.e. one set of eyes will look at land/water, another set of eyes will look for food, another set of eyes will look for other fish.

a ‘brain’ has 4 invisible muscles (brain.Muscle object, each controlling the movement in each direction).

between eyes and muscles are a neural network consists of neurons (brain.Neuron object) and connections (brain.Connections object). Number of layers and number of neurons can be specified.

act(t_point, action_histories, psp_waveforms, body_position, terrain_map, food_map=None, fish_map=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • t_point – int, current time stamp of time unit axis
  • action_histories – data frame of lists, each list is the action history of a particular neuron, in the same order as self._neurons data frame, columns = [‘action_history’]
  • psp_waveforms – 2d-array of floats, psp waveforms of all neurons in the brain, each row represents one neuron in the same order as self._neurons data frame, each column represents a time point
  • body_position – tuple of two ints, (row, col), current position of body center of the fish
  • terrain_map – 2d array, with only 0s (water) and 1s (land). represents the land scape of the world
  • food_map – 2d array, with only 0s (no food) and 1s (food). represents the distribution of food
  • fish_map – not fully implemented right now.
Returns:

movement_attempt: 2-d array, np.uint8, (row, col), representing the movement attempt, be careful, this may not represent the actual movement, it will be evaluated by the fish object (fish class) containing this brain to see if the movement is possible. if the fish is hitting the edge the world map, then the it will not move out of the map None: no movement has been attempted,

act(t_point, postsynaptic_index, psp_waveforms)[source]¶

if the presynaptic neuron fires at the ‘time_point’, a psp wave form will be generated and add to the input waveform of postsynaptic neuron defined by postsynaptic_index

Parameters:
  • t_point – int, current time point as the index of time unit axis
  • postsynaptic_index – non-negative int, the index of postsynaptic neuron
  • psp_waveforms – 2-d array, float 32, the psp waveforms of all neurons in the brain, neuron id x t-point, the generated psp will be added to the postsynaptic_index th line of the array
Returns:

class littlefish.core.fish.Eye(direction, input_filter=None, gain=0.001, input_type=’terrain’, baseline_rate=0.0, refractory_period=1.2)[source]¶

Bases: littlefish.core.fish.Neuron

Eye class to observe the environment and the inside of fish body, subclass of Neuron, has eye sight as 2 pixels

act(t_point, body_position, input_map, action_history=[], border_value=1, probability_base=None)[source]¶

evaluate if the eye neuron will fire at given time point

Parameters:
  • t_point – int, current time point as the index of time unit axis
  • body_position – tuple of two ints, (row, col), position of the body center pixel
  • input_map – binary 2-d map, for now it should only contain 0s and 1s
  • action_history – list of positive integers, list of time stamps of actions of this neuron, should be monotonically increasing
  • border_value – int, default 1, value for pixels outside the terrain_map
  • probability_base – float, a random number no less than 0 and less than 1, to determine if the neuron is going to act or not, if None, a random number will be generated by random.random()
Returns:

bool, True: fire; False: quite
copy()[source]¶
Returns:a copy of self for i.e. mutation

class littlefish.core.fish.Fish(name=None, mother_name=None, brain=None, max_health=100.0, health_decay_rate=0.0001, land_penalty_rate=0.005, food_rate=20.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

the main fish class

a ‘fish’ has a body occupies a 3x3 space.

a ‘fish’ has health point (goes down over time and increases after eating a food). fish moves around in a 2d landscape (2-d binary map, 0 represents water, 1 represents land), when hits land, health point will go down quickly.

the purpose of simulation is to train the fish use its eyes, brain and muscles to avoid land and look for food.

the simulation works on “real-time” basis on a time unit axis (consider one time unit is equivalent to 0.1 millisecond.

Attr _brain:a brain.Brain object
Attr _max_health:
 float, maximum health point a fish can have
Attr _health_decay_rate:
 float, the constant rate of health reduction, health point / time unit
Attr _land_penalty_rate:
 float, the penalty of health point, if the fish’s body covers land pixels (1s) in the terrain map, health point / (pixel * time unit)
Attri _food_rate:
 float, the gaining of health point if fish’s body covers food pixels (1s) in the food map, health point / pixel. the food after taken will disappear, so no health gaining is a transient event
act(t_point, curr_position, curr_health, action_histories, psp_waveforms, terrain_map, food_map=None, fish_map=None)[source]¶

simulate the fish’s action at a given time point

Parameters:
  • t_point – non-negative int, time point
  • curr_position – list or tuple of two non-negative integers, coordinates of fish center position, [row, col]
  • curr_health – positive float, health point at the beginning of t_point
  • action_histories – data frame of lists, each list is the action history of a particular neuron, in the same order as self._neurons data frame, columns = [‘action_history’], used by self._brain.act()
  • psp_waveforms – 2d-array of floats, psp waveforms of all neurons in the brain, each row represents one neuron in the same order as self._neurons data frame, each column represents a time point, used by self._brain.act()
  • terrain_map – 2d array, with only 0s (water) and 1s (land). represents the land scape of the world
  • food_map – 2d array, with only 0s (no food) and 1s (food). represents the distribution of food
  • fish_map – not fully implemented right now.
Return updated_health:
 

float, health point at the end of t_point
Return movement_attempt:
 

list of two integers, the attempt the fish is trying to move [row_shift, col_shift]. None if updated_health is below 0 (fish is dead).
copy()[source]¶
Returns:a copy of self for i.e. mutation

class littlefish.core.fish.Muscle(direction, baseline_rate=0.001, refractory_period=500.0)[source]¶

Bases: littlefish.core.fish.Neuron

muscle class for determining the motion of the fish. Subclass of Neuron class

act(t_point, action_history=[], probability_input=0.0, probability_base=None)[source]¶

evaluate if the muscle will try to move the fish or not

Parameters:
  • t_point – int, current time point as the index of time unit axis
  • probability_input – float, summed connection inputs, as add on to baseline_rate
  • action_history – list of positive integers, list of time stamps of actions of this neuron, should be monotonically increasing
  • probability_base – float, a random number no less than 0 and less than 1, to determine if the neuron is going to act or not, if None, a random number will be generated by random.random()
Returns:

no attempt: False attempt: movement vector, 1d array with two ints, [row_update, col_update]

littlefish.core.fish.get_eye_type(ind, dir_num=4)[source]¶

given the neuron_ind in the eye layer return direction and input type of a specific eye

Parameters:
  • ind – non-negative int, index of the eye in eye layer
  • dir_num – 4 or 8, if 4, eye directions iterate through 4 cardinal directions; if 8, eye directions will iterate through 8 directions
Returns:

two strings, (direction, type)
